courseDescription:
If you are a web developer or a coding student fascinated by web page design, this course is suitable for your needs. It is unique and, despite being in-depth, is easy to understand. You will learn tips and tricks used to increase your efficiency when coding. It also provides step-by-step instructions on how to create a web page from scratch. The material explains why many developers use Sass and describes the advantages and disadvantages of using this service. In response, you will see why independent web designer Ethan Marcotte found it necessary to invent the idiom 'responsive web design'. The course describes how this breakthrough is beneficial to web development today.

The next section introduces you to different ways of making images responsive and optimized. You will learn why a CDN (content delivery network) can handle more traffic and endure hardware breakdowns better than many original servers. Next, we will expose you to different website designs and help you understand how they are modified to fit your device screens. You will study their pros and cons, if any, and ascertain the main reasons why you design a website to cater to each device. Finally, explore the different file types used to assist with the coding of your website and see how these files significantly influence the result of your design.

Finally, this course enlightens you about the advancements made in web development over the years. While many improvements have been made, it is also evident that more needs to be done. Sass is an excellent means for website developers who want to enhance their web design with fundamental programming functions. The installation is straightforward, and the Sass language and syntax are quick to study. In addition, the diverse programming functions create more realistic stylesheets. This course will explore all the areas of Sass and NPM to help you grasp how they work. Are you ready to start your career in website development?
